definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: I love my family housing intermediaries responsible person clearly expressed his views.
sentences.chinese: 房屋中介機構我愛我家的負責人明確表示了他的觀點。

sentences.english: Having decided to rent a house, we set about contacting all the accommodation agencies.
sentences.chinese: 決定租房以後，我們便着手聯繫所有的房屋中介公司。

sentences.english: Me too. I can contact a real estate agent in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 我也是，我明早聯繫一下房屋中介。

sentences.english: The realtor told me this apartment has been rented.
sentences.chinese: 房屋中介告訴我這間公寓己經租出去了。

sentences.english: Paul decides to go through a realtor to save himself the trouble of running all over town looking.
sentences.chinese: 保羅決定通過房屋中介，省去到城裏到處亂找的麻煩。

sentences.english: The final leasing contract of accommodation will be signed between Party B and local agent.
sentences.chinese: 乙方赴美后直接和房屋中介公司簽訂公寓合同。

definition: second-hand house/house acquired indirectly through a middle-man
rent for a room or house
(of a house or room) to be for rent
building under construction/commercial property/real estate (for sale or rent)
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
matchmaking/abbr. for 婚姻介紹|婚姻介绍
developer (of real estate, a commercial product etc)
